intro: Centaurea amadanensis subsp. ranjbarii, commonly known as the Amadán ranjbarii centaury, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small, bracteate flower heads. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
